intro: Lesquerella obdeltata, commonly known as the wild mustard, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has a distinctive, pungent odor similar to other members of its family. Its seeds are used in the production of oils and have applications in the cosmetic and pharmaceutical industries. Lesquerella obdeltata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
